crazyballrun.game.utilities

Class QuadTree<Value extends java.lang.Comparable & java.io.Serializable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • crazyballrun.game.utilities.QuadTree<Value>
  • Type Parameters:
    Value - content type of the quadtree

    public class QuadTree<Value extends java.lang.Comparable & java.io.Serializable>
extends java.lang.Object
    The QuadTree class is a descrete representation of a continous domain. It adaptively increase accuracy where changes of data in the domain are high.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  QuadTree.Node
      The Node class represents nodes in the QuadTree.

        Throws:
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - file violates xml-standard
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - file violates xml-standard

      • QuadTree

        public QuadTree(long x1,
        long y1,
        long x2,
        long y2,
        long minSize)
        Creates an instance of QuadTree.
        Parameters:
        x1 - top left point of the domain
        y1 - top left point of the domain
        x2 - bottom right point of the domain
        y2 - bottom right point of the domain
        minSize - minimum node size

    • Method Detail

      • insert

        public boolean insert(long x,
             long y,
             Value content)
        Inserts a new element into the quadtree. If the node already exists, its content will be replaced.
        Parameters:
        x - position of the element
        y - position of the element
        content - reference to the element's content
        Returns:
        'true' if the insertion has been successfull

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.image.BufferedImage out,
         java.util.HashMap<Value,java.awt.Color> colorTable)
        Renders the quadtree into the image.
        Parameters:
        out - reference to the output image
        colorTable - reference to the color map (which content should be painted with which color)

        Parameters:
        node - node from where to start recursion
        out - reference to the output image
        colorTable - reference to the color map (which content should be
        borderColor - color of the border painted with which color)
